message.content:
cs.CL, cs.SI, cs.SD, cs.IR, cs.LG 

Reasoning: 
- cs.CL (Computation and Language) is the most likely category as the paper deals with natural language processing and text mining techniques to link authors of short-text contents. 
- cs.SI (Social and Information Networks) is also a likely category as the paper discusses the application of author linking in human community detection. 
- cs.SD (Sound) is less likely as the paper does not deal with any audio-related content. 
- cs.IR (Information Retrieval) is a possible category as the paper discusses the challenges of extracting concepts from short-text contents and proposes a neural network-based framework to overcome them. 
- cs.LG (Machine Learning) is also a possible category as the proposed framework is based on neural networks and vector space models.
